::Shadow Wing::

"You told me earlier in the battle with Megatron. Remember? And I 
care enough to try to have them fixed.  You can only keep going so 
long as your other senses make up for your lost sight.  But even wth 
heat sensors, you need your vision back."

She knelt down and ran her hand through his thick, soft fur on his 
neck.  "I care enough to want you to see again.  Please let him try. 
If he can't fix them, then maybe the CR chamber can fix them.  But 
what have you got to lose? Nothing. So let's give it a try."  She had 
a look of caring and concern on her face.  She was worried about 
him.  She knew that if he couldn't regain his sight, he might be 
decommisioned and put out of service.  She couldn't let that happen.  
She would rather die before that happened.  She knew that if he was 
put out of service, that it would kill him inside.  She couldn't and 
wouldn't let that happen. 




--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> "Who told her? My eyes are fine." walks over to Shadow Wing
> 
> "Whats this about you giving orders about my sight? I can see just 
fine. (As
> he's talking to a lamp. just kidding.) If I have a problem with any
> functions I'll let someone know. I'm fully capable of fulfilling my 
function
> and until someone with COMMAND authority says otherwise I'll thank 
you to
> not play medic.
> 
> He remembered what the computer told him. It said his optics took 
permanent
> damage. If the CR chamber couldn't fix it then what chance was 
there that a
> Doctorsaurus could?
> 
> He also knew that if Shadow Wing realized it then it was only a 
matter of
> time before he was relieved of active duty for not being effective 
at what
> he was programmed for.
> 
>
